original: Jansson, Ernst Ludvig, folkskolinspektör, Ulricehamn, f. 18/6/86 i Lyse, Gbgs o. Boh. 1., av Janne Jakobsson o. Albertina Larsson. G. 15 m. Karin Olsson, d. 47. Barn: Inger f. 17, Helena 24, Harald 29. — Folikskoill :ex. i Gbg 07, pedag. ntb:kurser. Stud:res. m. stip. Vik. folksk :lär. i Håby 07, i Halmstad 07, folksk :lär. i Uddevalla 08-21, överlär. v. Ulricehamns folk- o. forts :sk. 21-29, vik. folksk :insp. i Älvsb. s., Skarab. s., Nordskånes ö. o. Södermani. ö. insp :omr. 26-28, folksk :-insp. i Älvsb. ,s. insp :omr. sed. 29. Vik. und :visn :råd und. ett 10-tal perioder fr. 42, led. av stadsfullm. 26-40, fd. led. av barnav :nd, v. ordf. i iStyr. f. Ulricehamns samrealsk., ordf. i stadens lönend. RVO 45.
translated:
Jansson, Ernst Ludvig, school inspector, Ulricehamn, born June 18th, 1886 in Lyse, Gothenburg and Bohuslän county, son of Janne Jakobsson and Albertina Larsson. Married for 15 years to Karin Olsson, who passed away in 1947. They had three children: Inger, born in 1917, Helena, born in 1924, and Harald, born in 1929. 

Ernst Ludvig passed his teacher's exam in Gothenburg in 1907 and took pedagogical courses. He worked as a substitute teacher in Håby in 1907 and in Halmstad in the same year. From 1908 to 1921 he worked as a primary school teacher in Uddevalla, and from 1921 to 1929 he was the headmaster of Ulricehamns primary and secondary school. He worked as a substitute primary school inspector in Älvsborg county, Skaraborg county, Nordskåne county, and Södermanland county from 1926 to 1928, and became a primary school inspector in Älvsborg county, later a district primary school inspector, from 1929 onward. 

Ernst Ludvig was a temporary member of the council of undervisningsråd (a council for educational issues) during around 10 periods from 1942. He was a member of the city council from 1926 to 1940 and a former member of the board of the Children's Welfare Association. He was also the chairman of the board for Ulricehamn's secondary school and the chairman of the city's wage committee. He was awarded the RVO (Illustrious Order of the Royal House of Oueen Victoria) in 1945.

memberOf.name: Board of the Children's Welfare Association

award.name: The Illustrious Order of the Royal House of Oueen Victoria
